The Twelve Apostles
And*p when He had called His twelve disciples to Him,*i He gave them power over*i unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease.
Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son*i of Zebedee, and John his brother;
Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son*i of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
Simon the Cananite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.
